poem:
**Unexpected Harmony in the Oval Office**

The gold of the room  
twinkles like an uneasy truce,  
words exchanged as uncertain  
as dangling conversations.  
  
Yet, they find themselves  
in a rare alignment—  
promises float like thin paper  
in the brisk New York wind.  
  
"Absolutely," he says,  
as if home were a simple  
matter of agreement.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
